question: Which among the following are the planets nearest to Sun?
explanation:
In 2006, the International Astronomical Union (IAU) decided on the definition of a planet. The definition states that in our Solar System, a planet is a celestial body which:
• is in orbit around the Sun
• has sufficient mass to assume hydrostatic equilibrium (a nearly round shape)
• has “cleared the neighborhood” around its orbit
• is not a moon
Our Solar System has eight planets which orbit the sun. In order of distance from the sun they are: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune. Pluto, which until recently was considered to be the farthest planet, is now classified as a dwarf planet.
